adjectives.description: connected (comparative more connected, superlative most connected)

entries.meaning: (usually with "well-"): Having favorable rapport with a powerful entity.
(Canada, US) Involved with organized crime, specifically someone not (yet) working for a crime organization, but referred to as a "friend" by made guys/wise guys inside the organization.
(mathematics, topology, of a topological space) That cannot be partitioned into two nonempty open sets.
(mathematics, graph theory, of a graph) Having a path, either directed or undirected, connecting every pair of vertices.
examples: In a connected graph, there is no section (proper subset that includes all edges from each vertex in said subset) of the graph that is isolated from the rest.

entries.meaning: Having or supporting connections, especially when through technology such as networking software or a transportation network.
simple past tense and past participle of connect
